paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR Val30Met variant in the context of familial amyloid polyneuropathy, providing insights into penetrance data and clinical correlations.

patients.demographics: Aged between 17 and 84 years, both male and female

functional_data.summary: The study indicates that the Val30Met mutation leads to significant morphometric changes in nerve biopsies.

variants.segregation_data: The Val30Met mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the early onset of symptoms in asymptomatic carriers and the correlation with amyloid deposition.
key_quotes: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy with the substitution of methionine for valine at position 30 in the TTR gene is the most common type of hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.
Asymptomatic carriers showed loss of small myelinated fibres when compared with controls.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR Val30Met variant.
